title: pykes excute has to be the worst designed excute in the game
body: like atleast cho and darius have to stack before they get to do an excute fucking pyke is just your hp cant get low and then it gives everyone gold as a kill and its aoe like fuck this champ and resets

replies.body:
It's so horribly designed it thresholds not even on %HP, but FLAT HP, which also for some reason scales on 3 separate stats; level, bonus AD, and lethality, so it means that it scales into late and gets stronger when Pyke stacks typical AD assassin items. Good luck being executed at half HP.

Better yet, it ignores shield. If your HP checks the threshold test. Kiss goodbye and no amount of shield will save you because reasons.

And it resets! The show never ends! What's next?

And it duplicates kill gold, too! So Pyke can't even run into the gold-sink problem that high kill threat champs are fundamentally balanced by, where they can sit on too much gold they don't even use leading to a starved and lost team, since he basically just duplicates kill gold for his team. Isn't that just lovely...

... And absolutely appalling?

Don't forget, he has both the highest base HP and highest base armor (130 mother fucking armor, btw, ***15 fucking more armor than the next closest, BRAUM who, despite being THE warden, who only uses a massive, unbreakable shield as a weapon, only gets 115***) in the entire game, as a hyper mobile assassin, with free massive regen, invisibility, AoE hard CC, and AoE resetting nukes/executes that duplicate gold and now give him more gold for an assist than the bloke who actually lands the kill.

> [{quoted}](name=Yets4240,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=nu1bgyQk,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2019-07-12T20:48:51.733+0000)
>

lol i didnt know he had 130 wtf

> [{quoted}](name=ZeroAgainst,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=nu1bgyQk,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2019-07-12T20:57:34.962+0000)
>
> lol i didnt know he had 130 wtf

It's because he cannot build health. His effective HP through base stats has to be higher to compensate.
The compensation is that HP is turned into AD. He doesnt need to be compensated by also having tons of base HP and Armor.

> [{quoted}](name=Infernape,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=nu1bgyQk,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2019-07-12T22:53:48.123+0000)
>
> It's because he cannot build health. His effective HP through base stats has to be higher to compensate.

I mean heavens forbid champs has a real weakness, but your right Pyke being squishy is a weakness, i mean the fact alone he is immobile, lacks sustain, or real escapes or cc means he gets caught out super ea- PFFTHAHAHAHAHAH sorry i couldn't say it all with a straight face.

To be more serious, no he doesn't need higher Armour stats, his already has a bunch of BS sustain,cc and mobility idiot proof safety nets under the justification of being a '''''support''''. So no he hardly needs those extra stats, Pykes whole issue is he feel about as unfair as a CertT champion with the amount of stuff he gets to compensate for what would be weaknesses. Last time i checked Assassin are not really meant to be able to completely lock down and self peel themselves while having a huge sustain but because they has the excuse that he is a support, they can cover all those bases without issue. He is going to have the same running issue as CertT champs, not matter how strong or weak he is, his innate kit is unfair to play against.
No see that's the problem, he's an assassin and it's not like he _can't_ build hp, it's that **it's turned into more fucking damage**
The armor is absolutely ridiculous, but the HP makes total sense because he can't build it.

> Don't forget, he has both the highest base HP

Let's ignore the fact that he literally can't buy HP…
Let's ignore the actual fact that he CAN by HP, and it is turned into AD.
That's obviously what I meant, it just explains why his base HP is so high…

But the reason people don't like it (me included) and some of his core issues is that that is the trade off; No HP from items, gain AD instead. Why is he being triple compensated for it? 

1. Gains AD instead 
2. Insanely High base HP.
3. Insanely high base Armor.

Not even including his insane passive HP regen...... so really hes getting Quadruple compensated.....

He's a assassin with actually little reliable escape, and the HP-to-AD conversion is not gold efficient. The high base HP offsets that. Also, what matters most is not his AD itself but his ratios, which are actually not that high.

His regen is reliant on his already unreliable escape. You have to take a holistic approach when evaluating a champion.

Hes also an assassin with 2 HARD CCs. 

> You have to take a holistic approach when evaluating a champion.
He's also the assassin with the lowest damage in the game and the most unreliable escape.
LMAO. Maybe, just maybe lowest single target damage. But seeing as all 3 of his damage abilities are/can be AoE he can deal SHIT tons of damage in team fights.

Wait, what? The threshold being flat hp is actually a good thing.

It means you can counter him by purchasing HP items.

> [{quoted}](name=zepdrix,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=nu1bgyQk,comment-id=00010002,timestamp=2019-07-13T00:26:31.312+0000)
>

People purchasing hp items aren't gonna be his target.... Forehead. It being flat damage means he can execute a literal half hp adc from out of a bush. Just with ult. You gonna buy hp items as jinx?
Good for tanks, bad for Carrie's. Which is perfectly acceptable in this case cause he is an assassin who's goal is to kill carries

you forgot to mention that it also has a fairly high range unlikr darius and cho, while not beeing dodgeable without instant mobillity and without bodyblock unlike urgot, all while also beeing a gapcloser so it's hard to focus him while he can easily chain the resets unlike darius who still has to get close to every target woth no inherent mobillity in his kit...

Seriously, i really like the idea of pyke and his base kit, but that ult is just beyond busted.

> [{quoted}](name=Magnesium14,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=nu1bgyQk,comment-id=00010005,timestamp=2019-07-13T21:07:36.168+0000)
>
> I mean doesn't Darius have similar chain executes too.

He needs to be able to smack you with an auto or something first before ulting again, which leaves a window for getting away or ccing him. Darius also can't execute multiple people at once. Also darius ult isn't instant and is never out of nowhere cause u need to get stacked first while pyke's is near instant and from a bush. Also you can be damaged by pyke r multiple times. If you and ur supp gets hit and ur supp dies, you'll take the damage from the ult and then get ulted again. Also pyke can chain his ults very quickly without any other gimmicks which makes his cleanup very strong. Also Darius actually needs to kill you to reset while Pyke's resets if anyone dies in the cross. Also Darius, being a bruiser has a harder time getting on key targets while pyke has a cc dash and a stealth. Also. Do you see how many also's. I'm not gonna say anything about the actual champ but if we just look at darius r vs pyke r. i think pyke's is stronger.

Yup, he has dashes, damage, cc, healing, invisibility and an execute.
Meanwhile...champions like mundo heal and slow... My point being new releases make the old champions so obsolete they seem to belong on another game. The meta changes but all champions should feel engaging and new releases shouldn't be so packed with tools

I'm not talking about playing against him I'm talking about how the skill is designed compared to other executes

Darius stacks a DoT.  Honestly Pykes and Veigars executes are the only ones that actually make sense.

cho has to stack health veigars ults is another terrible design its a point and click missing health nuke

Cho doesn't have to stack anything.  It's the other way around; the ult stacks him.

"I have to stack health" - just like pyke and darius "stack AD" to make their execute do more.  (and you can stack AP with chogath just fine anyyways).

once you're in combat there's no stacking up that Cho needs to do.  It is completely different from Darius.
BuT hE cAnT bUiLd HPpPpPp ~ every Pyke main ever

The shape of it is such that it’s very hard to aim and very easy to dodge.

Pyke cannot gain more max health thus he remains one of the squishiest champions in the game who can be focused down at the beginning of a fight if you’re worried about him.

.

> can be focused down at the beginning of a fight if you’re worried about him.

Pykes goes EW; broken regen, so stealth, much mobility, very CC, huehuehue never die.

I mean, he can’t regain health if there is vision of him. So, you either sit inside his circle, you use a control ward, you have someone on your team with a vision ability (ex: Ashe), and he can’t regen (but wasted his ability with a decent cooldown).

I’m not saying I think Pyke is perfect - but he’s definitely not as broken as some champions.

I probably wouldn't give Pyke nearly as much salt if only his base kit wasn't attached to such an overloaded ulti (explanation in my first comment in thread).

I think most of his scaling and health->AD should be completely reconsidered. I think he could be a much healthier champion while still being fun to play and able to win/carry without being a “make or break” champion as he is now.

Since when does Cho have to stack anything to execute you? As long as you're low enough he just eats you.

> [{quoted}](name=Leetri,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=nu1bgyQk,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2019-07-12T23:16:09.894+0000)
>
> Since when does Cho have to stack anything to execute you? As long as you're low enough he just eats you.

I'm guessing they mean for his ultimate to be able to execute you from a substantial amount of HP.
Fuck {{champion:555}}

What does Cho have to stack to execute?

Also, are we conveniently forgetting about Urgot? And the fact that his ult is a skillshot?

I hate Cho, but he at least has to walk up to you to eat you, and it's a single target without resets. Urgot's skillshot can be body blocked and doesn't scale with damage, the treshhold will always be the same (25%). No other champion with executes or high true damage ulties have Pyke's amount of mobility and regen and resets (except Darius who resets ults but still has to walk up to every single target).

I mean, we have to put things in perspective, too:

Urgot: fairly tanky (juggernaut), ult is a massively ranged linear skillshot, slows, deals %HP pure damage (the thing we're supposed to be against, remember?), and AoE fear afterwards.

Cho: very tanky, ult is point-and-click true damage, gives permanent and indefinitely-stacking health, which amplifies subsequent damage.

Darius: fairly tanky (juggernaut), ult is point-in-click true damage, scales with passive stacks, activates passive, resets on kill.

Pyke: overly squishy (can't build HP), ult is an X-shaped skillshot (easy to miss or dodge), deals physical damage if not executing, makes you blink to melee range on hit (potentially killing you in the process).

You see, it's easy to just portray things a certain way. Pyke's ult has pros, and it has cons. Pyke is an assassin, the ult threshold is a fixed amount to kill squishies, while Urgot's is a %HP amount because he's a tank killer. Pyke's is ranged because he needs to be able to leave melee afterwards, while Darius has sustain mechanics for fighting at close range, and Cho has CC to reach his opponent. Pyke's give more gold because he's an assassin with a support's income and he needs to execute to be functional.

An advice: if you think you'll be ulted by Pyke, move up/down/left/right. His ult's shape is diagonal; moving in the cardinal directions will make you leave the hitbox fairly quickly.
cho doesnt have to stack. it just does more damage with stacks (and he has to go meele range)

Pyke, Darius and Chogath have very different power managed throwout their kit, of course their executes are going to be different. 

Without his R Pyke is slippery but otherwise absurdly weak by assassin standards or melee support standards.

Darius is strong all around even without his ult and Chogath is a moving CC machine that can 1k True damage demolish you, not to mention he can also steal objectives with it.

Dont compare the power placed into one aspect of Pykes kit to another champion's without looking at the rest of his abilities genius.
